item.title: HOW TO Can’t Install Windows 7 upgrade with Virtualbox
item.description: This is an extremely short guide to a major problem with Windows 7 using Virtualbox. Many users come to this site looking to find the answer – which is – Windows 7 Home Upgrade is sold in Europe and elsewhere as a full install version. The problem is that installation via Virtualbox will complete but the user will not be able to ‘register’ their copy Windows 7. The only way to install Windows 7 Upgrade using Virtualbox is to first install Windows XP and then run the Windows 7 Upgrade disc.

item.title: HOW-TO install Ubuntu using Virtualbox on a Mac
item.description: How easy is it to install Ubuntu on your Mac– this quick visual guide will have Ubuntu running within your Mac os X in under 20mins.If you’re really keen – maybe you want to use my guide on Virtualbox & install Windows XP on your MacGetting Started Follow my instructions to download and install Virtualbox on your Macor Grab a copy of Virtualbox from virtualbox.org Virtualbox Main Screen Launch Virtualbox and click on New Virtualbox Create New Virtual Machine for Ubuntu Give your new virtual machine a name like Ubuntu Select Linux and Ubuntu from the drop downs Virtualbox Set Memory Set base memory to at least 1Gb.

item.title: How to install Virtualbox on a Mac
item.description: This is 2 minute guide covering how to get Virtualbox and install it on your Mac. item.title: Upgrading to Virtualbox 3.0 and Mac OSx hosts

item.title: 15 minute guide to Virtualbox Windows 7 RC1 and your Mac
item.description: So this follows an earlier post of mine about Virtualbox and running Windows XP on a Macbook Pro. Virtualbox is a great piece of software for running virtual operating systems on another machine (like runing Windows 7 on a Mac OSX).Today’s guide shows that you can be up n running with Windows 7 RC in about 15 minutes … thats got to be good ?? So Grab your Windows 7 RC1 ISO file from the Windows website, grab a copy of Virtualbox for Mac and get going.

item.title: HOW TO install Virtualbox on Mac osx host & WinXp guest using TinyXP rev 09
item.description: Virtualbox is a dream freeware solution for anyone – novice to geek – who wants to run different computers inside their computer … virtual so to speak. Today I’ve been tinkering with getting Virtualbox working on a Mac laptop running WinXP. Virtualbox from Oracle Sunis a freeware, open source virtualisation application .. it comes in a number of flavours – I’ve previously used it to run WinXP guests inside WinXP hosts for testing and at work it was the only way to install things without having to go to the IT helpdesk.
